text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new smith westerns record soft will
this is the third full-length LP from
the chicago illinois pop rock act i
first heard of them back in 2011 through
their second full-length LP daya blonde
and album that i enjoyed quite a few
songs from with this LP sketchy
songwriting and really bubbly mood it
was easily some of the most blissed-out
indie pop of 2011 and it wasn't
blissed-out because of too much reverb
or anything like that mostly it was
Kandi Koated melodies kaleidoscopic
choruses that bursts like fireworks but
even with all of this melodic beauty and
just really strong pop sensibilities
throughout these tracks there was a
small very tiny element of sadness in
the band's music like white like as I
was listening to these tracks I was
imagining every member of the band
apathetically playing the songs with a
single tear streaming down every one of
their faces for sure there is a really
sentimental element to their take on on
very jangly pop rock there were quite a
few tracks from from their last record
in this new record - that actually
reminds me a bit of girls debut LP
however this was not an album that I was
totally head-over-heels for that I was
completely in love with I felt that the
vocals were sort of obscured and then
some of the songs more ambitious
beautiful moments were really choked off
by the sort of low five recording
quality however better recording quality
comes through on soft will and sort of
rides in and saves the day like a knight
in shining armor making soft will I
think my favorite Smith westerns record
well is Langa's were sharing favorites
the wild wild west is my favorite Will
Smith Western I hate Cal Church esta but
seriously soft will is is a pretty big
improvement on the band's last record I
think with the very boyish vocals the
slightly jangly guitar chords the very
sharp guitar leads all coming in loud
and clear in HD 1080p
the band does bring a good mix to their
sound this time around you could really
swim through there really heavenly
approach to rock music and I think this
clarity makes their mix of influences
really obvious this time around too and
in a good way pop rock psychedelic pop
piano rock and I think a little bit of
progressive rock too with the song 23
the only instrumental on this album
sounding exactly like something Pink
Floyd would have done with some really
epic guitar soloing and some slow
drumming ethereal piano keys the only
real downside to this track is that it
doesn't really fit in with the flow of
the rest of the album which is pretty
much just a very nice mixed bag of pop
rock songs and even though pop music at
least today is stereotyped a lot to be
very light and very breezy at least I
can tell that Smith westerns really
labored over these tracks put them
together and really took a particular
approach to writing these guitar
melodies whether it be lead one the lead
on top of that lead the bass line
underneath it all the vocal melody all
of it really winding and intertwining
weaving bing-bing-bing-bing together and
complementing one another at every turn
in the song structure hell of a
sparkling synth melody is all over the
track the opening track 3 a.m. spiritual
as well as the huge chorus vocals wow
yeah
the bass feels really warm in the mix
the drums have a nice punch to them the
vocals are right up front and center in
the spotlight and the synthesizers add
this indescribable thickness to this to
this track and others too that really
makes me feel like I'm listening to the
band live and I'm seeing this fog roll
in from a fog machine or maybe some
laser lights it's just this really
beautiful extra piece of ambience and
the piano changed toward the end of the
track that leads into a really great
guitar solo the band really switches
things up suddenly in a very sort of let
it be Abbey Road type fashion it's a
great climactic ending with the vocals
growing larger and larger and larger and
this is one of many tracks on this LP
that actually has a pretty nice ending
to it with the band adding an extra
guitar lead or totally changing the flow
of the song the groove of it up like the
song idle which introduces a totally
different part of the song with a new
vocal against these downstroke guitar
chords or full-proof which has one of
the best guitar leads on this entire
album the band's ballads get incredibly
slow and sort of dramatic too with
tracks like white oath which is one of
the moments on this album where the
lyrics really stand out singing about
chain-smoking you're days away writing
poetry that no one ever really reads and
even though the lyrics here are pretty
nice the vocals do feel like the weakest
link in the chain where they're
straining to reach a certain note or
maybe they're not really controlling the
pitch that they're singing all that well
there's a really strong element of why
ninis of wimpiness to the vocals that
sort of reminds me of a very early of
montreal records but no matter what
shortcomings soft will does deliver up
from time to time it's really the
instrumentation the production and just
the songwriting that that shines through
immensely because even on songs like
cheer up and best friend where I'm not
totally in love with the vocals I'm
still completely enthralled with the
melodies I thought pretty much all of
these songs were solid and an incredibly
enjoyable at its worst this album is a
really good summer record for 2013 I'm
feeling a strong 7 - a light 8 on this
thing if you've given it a listen
what did you think of it what did I
review next and that's it this review is
my opinion
if you don't like it here's a straw I
want to give a shout out to people who
have dreams about me and Cal Church esta
Mike C town zombie and 160k thank you
only the strong subscribe all mistakes
were intentional Anthony Fantana Smith
westerns forever
